event.name: TRANSPORT_JERRY_LOOT

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: A familiar transport vessel is nearby, and you catch their captain talking to one of the crew. "Yes, we're carrying important cargo to be brought straight to the Wentworth estate. You know this already, why are you asking me? Imagine there was a Federation vessel, hell, the same one that chased us here, that just happened to be in the same system listening to us? It would be disastrous!"

choice.text: Jerry is on board... do you have anything for him?

event.text: The Rebels aboard the transport seem to panic at the sight of you. Their captain growls. "Like we'll believe that, you son of a..." His facial expression changes once he realizes that Jerry is, in fact, next to you. "Oh! Jerry! Well, this was supposed to be a surprise but... one moment." The people on the other end hasten to set something up. Finally, with a flourish, they reveal the interior of their ship, decorated with party supplies. "Surprise! ...Sorry about the shoddy job, we really weren't expecting to have to set it up here of all places. Come on over, you're all invited!"

You and your crew, including Jerry, help yourselves to the meal they're serving. After a short snack, the Rebels carry a gigantic pile of boxes to Jerry. "For you, Wentworth!" Most of the boxes contain things like sweaters, board games, birthday cards and a giant cannon. "We hope you like it, Jerry!"
Jerry smiles and nods, but seems a little overwhelmed by it all.

choice.text: Demand the surrender of their goods.

event.text: Upon seeing you, the Rebel captain spits out his cigarette. "ARE YOU KIDDING ME?! What the hell is this, roguelike RNG? Men, arm the guns, we've got trouble!"
You stay outside of detection range, and eventually the transport jumps away.

event.name: TRANSPORT_DESTROYED_JERRY
event.text: "I cannot express... just how much I hate you... Well, I hope it was worth ruining the birthday surprise..." You aren't quite sure what he means by 'birthday surprise', but with the cargo of the ship destroyed there's no way to find out.

choice.text: (Scrap Arm) Use the arm to collect extra scrap.
(Drone Arm) Use the arm to collect extra drone parts.
(Magnet Arm) Use the magnet to draw in some extra supplies.

event.name: TRANSPORT_CAPTURE_JERRY
event.text: "I cannot express... just how much I hate you... Well, I hope it was worth ruining the birthday surprise..."

You pry open the cargo bay doors, but are utterly confused by what's inside. There's almost no weapons, rather boxes of knitted sweaters, some bright and colorful cards, balloons, and a very strange looking cannon. Being the only remotely military-esque thing in the room, you take it off the wall, but to your disappointment it seems it fires... plushies...?

escape.text: It appears the Auto-Transport was hardwired to try to avoid combat. It's attempting to escape!

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: This beacon hosts a cultist transport. It's safe to bet the ship is most likely carrying some special tech. If you can kill its crew, their cargo will be yours.

choice.text: Demand the surrender of their goods.

event.text: You prepare to secure their cargo by force.
They stay outside your weapons range, and eventually jump away.

event.name: TRANSPORT_CAPTURE_CULTIST
event.text: The crew is dead, leaving you with the ship. Its cargo is yours for the taking. Aboard is the special tech you expected, which you bring back to your ship.

escape.text: They look like they don't want to fight. They are trying to escape.

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_TRANSPORT_STARGROVE_LOOT

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: The ship at this beacon is extremely unusual - even in its sorry state, the hull flickers and shines with an unnatural vibrance. The Vagabonds occupying it have no doubt stripped away most of the unique tech their vessel once held - if there's anything left, you're going to have to kill their crew for it.

choice.text: Demand the surrender of their goods.

event.text: You prepare to secure their cargo by force.
They stay outside your weapons range, and eventually jump away.

event.name: TRANSPORT_CAPTURE_STARGROVE
event.text: A strange force presses on your mind as you scrap the ship. Every scrape, every hull breach screams at you to repair it, even as all your common sense tells you that it doesn't matter. A weapon in one of the storage rooms begs you to mount it to the ship - you hope it's not picky about the details as you carry it aboard.
